meanings.definition: A small, unimportant, and isolated town or village.
meanings.sent1: The little podunk where I grew up had only one grocery store.
meanings.sent2: I visited a charming podunk during my road trip.
meanings.sent3: In the podunk, everyone knows each other's business.
meanings.sent4: The podunk was like a forgotten island in the sea of civilization.
meanings.sent5: The podunk was so tiny, it felt like a speck on the map.

meanings.sent1: She felt like she would podunk in the vast crowd of people.
meanings.sent2: I don't want to podunk in the background; I want to stand out.
meanings.sent3: He tried to podunk his role in the project, but we all knew he did the most work.
meanings.sent4: The idea of being just a number in the system made him feel like he would podunk.
meanings.sent5: Her dream was to podunk in a world where she could make a difference.
